3a09e48be46e5f4c95e864b529d3b79f.title: So many things to say Jon…but first, thank you. Thank you for calling something what it is.

paragraphs.text: People don’t want to pay for content. They want to consume it for free, or monetise it for themselves.
paragraphs.name: 34c6
5dea
paragraphs.text: We’ve screwed creative people over. We started doing that years ago, and I’m worried that it’s now too late to change it.

852945d758b9.title: People don’t want to pay for any art form.

paragraphs.name: d29a
paragraphs.text: People don’t want to pay for any art form. The more passion and imagination poured into it, the less valuable it seems to be. Look at art history. I have a few pieces of rare art, different media. Jo Schmoe will pay anything to keep up with the Jones’ mass-produced material stuff (quite often not fueling our disastrous economy), but art? Pftt.

paragraphs.name: e567
paragraphs.text: Ouch.

paragraphs.name: e4a7

93687f4f87b7.title: The price of writing has devalued to almost zero.

virtuals.subtitle: There are still a few well-paying online platforms available. Medium has started paying their top contributors (but I don’t know how much …

paragraphs.name: f4bc
paragraphs.text: The price of writing has devalued to almost zero. Look at Kindle, market prices for a 100-page book are between $0.99 and $4.99. So the price we’re willing to pay authors has dropped to 1–5 cents per page per reader. I remember when books were $25–40 in the bookstore, but those days are long gone. It’s very hard nowadays to earn a living purely with…

3b14a3fe84c7.title: It is very hard to earn by doing creative work unless you are really up or have a great godfather…

paragraphs.name: a808
paragraphs.text: It is very hard to earn by doing creative work unless you are really up or have a great godfather.Most of the time creative work is more of a labor of pain where the pain is more and the gains are far and few.But in spite of this it is the passion for the work and the limitless creative juices that keep these artists going on and on.

paragraphs.text: You’re confusing customers paying for the product (song, story, etc) with customers paying the distributor (streaming service, micropayment interface on your blog, etc). Long before the internet existed, the same problem occurred only it was much worse (look up“payola” on a search engine).

Also it’s much harder to be original and creative then it is to follow the status…

daecdd38a507.title: I also believe there are a lot of people wandering around who are creative at heart, but don’t put…

paragraphs.name: bf90
paragraphs.text: I also believe there are a lot of people wandering around who are creative at heart, but don’t put forth the effort to further develop their skills because their mainstream responsibilities crush them, and the incentive to push forward is nonexistent. That’s not to excuse laziness or lack of drive, but I do think a lot of untouched talent sits wasted because of everything you just said.
